title: Holy Cross dedicates court to Bob Cousy
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Holy Cross named its basketball court after Bob Cousy, a 1947 NCAA champion and Celtics legend, at a ceremony in Worcester.
Bob Cousy, 97, attended the event at the Hart Center, where Holy Cross beat Lehigh 76-67 and distributed purple 'Cousys'.
NCAA President Charlie Baker and sports analyst Bill Simmons attended the ceremony honoring Cousy’s legacy as an all-time great.

title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey proposes eliminating the 15-year statute of limitations for rape cases with a DNA match in Massachusetts.
The proposal mandates storing sexual assault evidence kits for at least 15 years and entering DNA profiles into the state database within 30 days.
Massachusetts currently has one of the strictest deadlines for rape cases, surpassed only by New Hampshire and North Dakota.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Patriots release hype video before facing the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on Sunday at 6:30 p.m.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes building a program players and staff are proud of in the motivational video.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs energizes teammates, asserting disbelief in the team's abilities among outsiders.

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, pleaded guilty to video voyeurism and obstruction charges after recording female co-workers at a Westminster post office.
Testagrossa, from Rindge, NH, hid cameras in the women's restroom, capturing videos of undressed co-workers without their consent.
He faces up to 20 years in prison for obstruction and one year for voyeurism, with sentencing scheduled for May 12, 2026.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jewish advocacy groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford's values-based investment ordinance, claiming it mandates unlawful ideological divestment.
The ordinance restricts investments in sectors like fossil fuels, defense, or human rights violations, impacting city funds and pensions.
The lawsuit argues the policy conflicts with Massachusetts investment rules, prioritizing political criteria over financial returns.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need a stellar performance from QB Drake Maye against Seattle's strong defense in Super Bowl LX.
New England aims to pressure Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, with 12 sacks and 8 turnovers in postseason so far.
Stopping Seattle's run game, particularly Kenneth Walker, is vital to enforce third-and-long situations.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest carried the No. 55 from USC to the Patriots, making it iconic during New England's NFL dynasty.
The No. 55 became a prestigious linebacker number at USC, started by Junior Seau, later adopted by McGinest.
Seau requested McGinest's blessing to wear No. 55 in Foxborough, honoring its significance to both players.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly each receiving 13 inches.
Bristol County saw notable snowfall, with Dartmouth receiving up to 8.2 inches by February 7.
Middlesex County recorded varying snow levels, with Marlborough receiving 7 inches and Winchester 6.2 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC when the Patriots face the Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Tirico will begin coverage at noon with the pregame show featuring Maria Taylor and various analysts.
After the Super Bowl, Tirico will host NBC's Olympic coverage from Levi's Stadium in a broadcasting double duty.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seahawks for Super Bowl LX, held at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
A Patriots win would mark the greatest single-season turnaround, going from winning 4 games to 18 in successive seasons.
Drake Maye could become the youngest quarterback to win a Super Bowl, starting as the second-youngest QB in history.
